result.execSummary:
The defendant Alainnah J. Mell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $150 applied to court costs Balance of court costs due during probation term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Upon successful completion of supervision with no rule violations.  Agent to file a memo with the court, 2 weeks prior to discharge date, outlining the defendant's adjustment on Probation.  The Agent is to specifically address whether the defendant had any rule violations; if so, what they were and when they occurred.

-Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. 
-No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
-Counseling for Mental Health/AODA as deemed appropriate.
-If agent feels defendant does not have probationary needs, agent may petition for an early discharge.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: -Defendant to perform 30 hours of community service.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
